juzs.text: Of what do they question one another
About the Great News
About which they are in disagreement
Verily, they shall soon come to know
Verily, verily, they shall soon come to know
Have We not made the earth an expanse
And the mountains as projections (thereon)
And created you in pairs
And made your sleep for rest
And made the night to be a covering
And made the day for livelihood and activity
And made above you seven firmaments (heavens)
And placed therein a shining lamp (the Sun)
And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance
That We may bring forth thereby corn and vegetable
And gardens dense and luxuriant
Surely the Day of Decision (or Sorting ) is a thing appointed
The day on which the trumpet shall be blown so you shall come forth in hosts
And the heaven shall be opened as if it were all doors
And the mountains shall be moved off so that they shall remain a mere semblance
Surely hell lies in ambush
A destination for those who transgress the bounds
Abiding therein for ages
They shall not taste therein anything cool nor drink
But boiling and intensely cold water
Requital corresponding (or proportional to their state)
Surely they feared not the account
And called Our revelations a lie with strong denial
And We have preserved all things in a Record
So taste you (the fruits of your deeds)! For We will not add to you aught but torment
Surely for the righteous is achievement (or success, self-fulfilment)
Gardens and vineyards
And those showing freshness of youth, equals in age
And a pure cup
They shall not hear therein any vain words nor lying
A reward from your Lord, a gift according to reckoning (or sufficient)
From the Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, the Beneficent Allah, with whom none can argue
The day on which the Spirit and the angels shall stand arrayed; they speak not except him whom the Beneficent permits and who speaks aright
That is the Day of Certain Reality, so whoever desires may take refuge with his Lord
Surely We have warned you of a doom near at hand: the day when man shall see that which his two hands have sent before, and the unbeliever shall say, "O! Would that I were dust
I swear by (or call to witness) those who tear out to destruction
And by those rushing
And by those who float
Then press forward as in a race
And those who regulate affairs
The day on which the first trump resounds (or that which can quake shall quake)
And others follow it
Hearts on that day shall palpitate
While eyes are cast down
They say, "Shall we indeed be restored to our first state
What! When we are rotten bones
They said, "That then would be a return, causing loss
But it shall be only a single cry
When lo! They will be fully awake
Has not there come to you the story of Moses
When his Lord called upon him in the holy valley of Tuwa
(Saying,) "Go to Pharaoh, surely he has transgressed beyond bounds
Then say, "Have you a desire to purify yourself
And I will guide you to your Lord so that you may fear
So he showed him the Mighty Sign
But he (Pharaoh) rejected it and disobeyed
Then turned he away (from Allah) in haste
Then he gathered (men) and made a proclamation
Saying, "I am your Lord, the most high
So Allah seized him with the punishment of the Hereafter and the former life
Most surely there is in this a lesson to him who fears
Are you the harder to create or the heaven? He created it
He raised high its height, and gave it order and perfection
And He made dark its night and its splendour does He bring out with light
And after that He expanded (spread) the earth
He brought forth from it its water and its pasturage
And the mountains, He made them firm
A provision for you and for your cattle
But when the great overwhelming calamity comes
The Day on which man shall recollect all he strove after
And Hell shall be made manifest to him who sees
Then for him who has transgressed all bounds
And prefers the life of this world
Surely, Hell will be his abode
And as for him who had feared standing in the presence of his Lord and restrains his soul from lust (or low desires)
Then surely the Garden, that is his abode
They ask you (Muhammad) about the Hour, when it will come
What," ask they, "have you to say about it
To your Lord belongs the knowledge of it
you are only a Warner to him who would fear it
On the day that they behold it, it will be as though they had not tarried but an evening or the morning
He frowned and turned his back
Because there came to him the blind man
And what would make you know that he would grow (spiritually)
Or that he might become heedful so that the reminder should profit him
As for him who considers himself independent (or self-sufficient)
To him do you attend
Yet no blame is on you if he grow not (spiritually)
And as to him who comes to you striving earnestly
And with the fear of Allah in his heart
From him were you unmindful (or distracted)
Nay! Verily, it is an admonishment (or a message of instructions)
So let whoever will pay heed to it
It is in honoured books
Exalted, purified
Set down by scribes
Noble and righteous
Cursed (self-destroyed) is man! How ungrateful (to Allah) is he
Of what stuff did He create him
Of a small seed; He created him, then gave him due proportions
Then He made his way easy for him
Then He causes him to die and buries him in his grave
Then when He wills, He will raise him to life again
Nay; but man has not done that which He bade him
Then let man consider his food
That We pour down the water in abundance
Then We cleave the earth
Then We cause to grow therein the grain
And grapes and clover
And the olive and the palm
And dense luxurious gardens
And fruits and herbage
A provision for you and for your cattle
But when the Deafening Noise (cataclysm) comes
The Day on which a man shall fly from his brother
And his mother and his father
And his spouse and his children
Every man of them shall on that Day be occupied with concerns which will make him heedless of others
Many faces on that Day shall be bright as dawn (or beaming with light)
Laughing, rejoicing
And many faces on that Day, shall be covered with dust
Veiled in darkness
These are the disbelievers, the wicked
When the sun is overthrown (or folded up)
And when the stars darken
And when the mountains pass away
And when the she-camels (with young) are left untended
And when the wild beasts are herded together
And when the seas swell and boil
And when souls are sorted and reunited
And when the female infant buried alive is asked
For what sin she was killed
And when the Record Books are spread open
And when the heavens are unveiled
And when Hell is kindled up
And when the Garden is brought nigh
Every soul shall then know what it has prepared
But nay! I swear by (or call to witness) the Planets
That run their course and hide themselves
And the Night when it departs
And the Dawn when it breaths away the darkness
Most surely it is the Word of an honourable Messenger
The possessor of power and high rank with the Lord of the Throne
One to be obeyed, and faithful to his trust
And your companion is not one possessed (or mad)
And of a truth he saw himself on the clear horizon
Nor is he a tenacious concealer of the unseen
Nor is it the word of the cursed Satan
Whither then will you go
It is naught but a reminder unto all creation (or all the worlds)
For him among you who wills to go straight
And you will not, unless Allah wills, the Lord (or Cherisher) of Creation (or all the Worlds)
When the heavens are cleft asunder
And when the stars are dispersed
And when the oceans are suffered to burst forth
And when the graves are overturned
Every soul shall know what it has sent before and held back
O man! What has beguiled you from your Lord, the Gracious one
Who created you, then completed your form in due proportions, then gave you balance (or an inclination to reason and justice)
Into whatever form He wills He castes you
Nay! But you deny the judgment
And most surely there are guardians over you
Honourable recorders
They know what you do
Verily, the righteous are in bliss
And verily, the wicked are in burning fire
They shall enter it on the Day of Judgment
And they shall by no means be absent from it
And what will convey unto you what the Day of Judgment is
Again, what will convey unto you what the Day of Judgment Is
The day on which no soul shall control anything for another soul; and the command on that day shall be entirely Allah´s
Woe to the defrauders
Who, when they take the measure of their dues from men take it fully
But when they give by measure or weight, they are deficient
Do not these think that they shall be raised again to account
On a Mighty Day
The day on which men shall stand before the Lord of the Worlds
Nay! Most surely the record of the wicked is in Sijjin
And what will explain to you what Sijjin is
It is an inscribed Record
Woe on that day to the rejecters
Who give the lie to the Day of Judgment
And none deny it but the transgressors beyond bounds, the sinful one
When Our revelations are recited to him, he says, "Stories of those of yore
Nay! But what they used to do has become like rust upon their heart
Nay! Most surely they shall on that day be debarred (or veiled) from their Lord
Then most surely they shall enter the burning Fire
Then shall it be said, "This is what you gave the lie to
Nay! Most surely the record of the righteous shall be in Iliyin
And what will explain to you what Iliyin is
It is an inscribed Record
Those who are drawn near to Allah shall witness it
Most surely the righteous shall be in bliss
On thrones, they shall gaze
You will see in their faces the brightness of bliss
They are given to drink pure wine, sealed
The sealing of it is with musk; and for that let the aspirers aspire
And the admixture of it is a water of Tasnim
A fountain from which drink they who are nearest to Allah
Surely they who are guilty used to laugh at those who believe
And when they passed by them, they winked at one another
And when they returned to their own folk they returned exulting
And when they saw them, they said, "Most surely these are truly astray
But they were not sent to be keepers over them
This day it is the believers who shall laugh at the unbelievers
On thrones (of dignity), they will gaze
Are not the disbelievers rewarded for what they did
When the heaven is rent asunder
And gives ear unto its Lord, and is dutiful
And when the earth is stretched out
And casts forth what is within it, and is emptied (or clean)
And gives ear unto its Lord, and is dutiful
O man! Verily, you are toiling on towards your Lord, painfully toiling; wherefore shall you meet Him
And as for him who is given his record in his right hand
His account shall be taken with an easy reckoning
And he shall go back to his people rejoicing
But as for him who is given his book behind his back
He shall call out for destruction
But he shall broil in a blazing Fire
Verily, he was amongst his family joyful
Verily, he thought that he should never return to Allah
Nay, nay! Verily, his Lord did watch him
So I do call as witness the glow of sunset
Or the night, and its homing
Or the moon in her fullness
You shall surely travel from stage to stage
What ails them that they believe not
And, when the Quran is read to them, they fall not prostrate
On the contrary, the unbelievers reject it
But Allah knows best the (malice) that they hide
So announce to them the grievous woe
Save those who believe and work right. For them is an unfailing reward
By the heaven with its zodiacal signs
And by the Promised Day
And by the witnesses and the witnessed
Self-destroyed were the owners of the pit
The fire of which was supplied with abundant fuel
Behold, they sat over it
And they witnessed all they were doing against the believers
And they mistreated them only for their belief in Allah, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy
Whose are the kingdoms of the heavens and the earth; for Allah is Witness over all
Verily, those who persecute (or mislead or tempt) the believers, men and women, and then do not repent, for them is the penalty of Hell: they will have the torment of the burning Fire
Verily, those who believe and do right, for them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow: that is the great bliss
Verily, strong is the power of your Lord
Verily, it is He who creates and restores
And He is the Forgiving, the Loving
The Lord of the Glorious Throne
The Doer of what He will
Has there come to you the story of the Hosts
Of Pharaoh and the Thamud
Yet the unbelievers persist in rejecting (the truth)
But Allah is behind them - encompassing
Nay, this is a glorious Quran
(Inscribed) in a Preserved Tablet
By the heaven and by the night or (morning) star
And what shall make you know what the night star is
The star of piercing brightness
Verily, every soul has a guardian over it
Then let man look from what he is created
He is created from a drop emitted
Which comes out from between the loins and the breast bones
Surely, He is able to bring back (to life)
On the day when the secrets shall be tried
And man shall have neither strength nor helper
By the Firmament which returns in its rounds
And the earth with its sprouting
Verily, this is indeed a discriminating word
And it is no frivolity
As for them, they do plot a scheme
But I plot my scheme too
So give respite to the unbelievers; deal you gently with them for a while
Glorify the name of your Guardian Lord most High
Who created and makes order and proportion
Who ordains Laws and Guides
Who brings forth the pasture
Then turns it to dusky stubble
We will teach you by degrees to declare (or recite), and you shall not forget
Save what Allah wills. Verily, Lo! He knows the open and the hidden
And We will ease your way into the simple (path)
Therefore, remind men, for, verily, the reminder is useful
But he who fears will be mindful
And the wretch will avoid it
He will broil in the great Fire
Wherein he shall neither die nor live
He is successful who grows
And remembers the name of his Lord and prays
Nay! But you prefer the life of this world
Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting
Verily, this was in the former books
The books of Abraham and Moses
Has the story reached you, of the overwhelming
Some faces on that day shall be humbled
Toiling, weary
While they broil upon a burning Fire
While they drink from a boiling spring
No food shall they have save from the bitter Dhari
Which shall not nourish nor avail against hunger
Other faces on that day shall be joyful
Content with their past endeavours
In a lofty (sublime) Garden
Wherein they shall hear no foolish word
Wherein is a flowing fountain
Wherein are Thrones (of dignity) raised on high
And goblets set down ready
And cushions arranged
And carpets spread
Do they not look then at the camel, how she is created
And at the heaven how it is raised high
And at the mountains how they are set firm
And at the earth how it is spread out
Therefore, remind them: for you are only one to remind
you are not in authority over them
But such as turns his back and disbelieves
Him will Allah punish with the greatest torment
Verily, unto us is their return
And, verily, for Us is their accounting
I swear by (or call to witness) the dawn
And by the nights twice five (of pilgrimage)
And the even and the odd
And the night when it passes on
Is there not in these a lesson (evidence or admonition) for a man of understanding
Have you not seen how your Lord did with the people of A´ad
With the city of Iram of the lofty pillars
The like of which has not been created in all the land
And with the people of Thamud when they hewed the great stones in the valley
And with Pharaoh, Lord of the stakes
All these were outrageous in the land
And did multiply wickedness therein
Therefore, your Lord poured out upon them the scourge of diverse torments
Verily, your Lord is ever watchful
Now as for man, whenever his Lord tries him and honours him and grants him favour, then he says, "My Lord has honoured me
But whenever he tries him and restricts his subsistence, then he says, "My Lord despises me
Nay, nay! But you do not honour the orphan
Nor do you urge each other to feed the poor
And you devour the inheritance (of the weak) with greed
And you love wealth with an abounding love
Nay, when the earth is crushed to pieces
And your Lord comes with the angels, rank on rank
And Hell is brought near on that Day, on that Day shall man remember! But how shall the remembrance profit him
He will say, "Would that I had sent something forward for my life
But on that Day none shall punish as He punishes
And none shall be bound with bonds like his
But O, you soul in peace and fulfilment
Return unto your Lord, well pleased and well pleasing unto Him
Enter you amongst My servants
Enter you My Garden (Paradise)
I swear (or call to witness) this City (Mecca)
And you (Muhammad) are a dweller of this City
And the (mystic ties) of Parent and Child
We have surely created man in suffering (struggle, trouble, sorrow)
Does he think that none has power over him
He says, "I have squandered wealth in plenty
Does he think that no one sees him
Have We not made for him two eyes
And a tongue, and two lips
And guided him in the two highways
But he has not attempted the ascent
And what will explain to you the ascent
It is freeing captives (or prisoners, slaves, the restricted or bound)
Or feeding on the day of privation
An orphan who is a kin
Or a destitute lying in the dust (of misery)
And again (it is) to be of those who believe and encourage each other to patience, and encourage each other to mercy
These are the fellows of the right
But those who disbelieve in our signs, they are the fellows of the left
For them is the enclosing Fire
By the sun and its noonday brightness
And the moon when it follows him
And the day when it displays him
And the night when it covers him
And the wondrous structure of the heavens and Him who built it
And the earth and Who spread it
And the soul and Who fashioned it
And enlightened it with what is wrong and right for it
He indeed is successful who causes it to grow (or purifies it)
And he indeed is a failure who corrupts it
The Thamud people denied (the Messenger) in their rebellious pride (or outrage)
When the basest of them rose up
And the Messenger of Allah (Salih) said to them, "(This is) Allah´s she-camel! So give her to drink
But they called him a liar, and they ham-strung her; so their Lord destroyed them in their sins, and served them all alike
And He fears not the result thereof
By the night when it veils
And the day when it is displayed
And by (the mystery) of male and female
Verily, your efforts are diverse
But as for him who gives alms and fears Allah
And believes in goodness
We will ease his way to ease
But as for him who is niggardly and thinks himself independent (or self-sufficient)
And calls the good a lie
We will ease his way to misery (adversity)
And his wealth shall not avail him when he falls down (into hell)
Verily, it is for Us to guide
And, verily, Ours are the Latter and the Former life
Therefore, I have warned you of a Fire that flames fiercely
None shall broil thereon, but the most wretched
Who says it is a lie and turns his back
But the pious shall be kept away from it
He who gives his wealth that he may grow
And who gives no favour expecting a return
But only desiring the face of his Lord Most High
In the end he shall be well fulfilled
By the glorious morning light
And the night when it is still
Your Lord has not forsaken you (Muhammad), nor is displeased with you
And surely the Hereafter is better for you than the present
And in the end your Lord will give you, and you shall be well pleased
Did He not find you an orphan, and give you protection
And find you wandering (or astray), and guide you
And find you in need, and enriched you (or made you independent)
Therefore, the orphan oppress him not
Nor the beggar (or petitioner) drive away
And as for the favour of your Lord, discourse (proclaim) thereof
Have We not expanded for you your breast
And set down from you your load
Which galled your back
And exalted for you your renown
Verily, with difficulty comes ease
Verily, with difficulty comes ease
So when you are at relieved, then still toil
And to your Lord turn all your yearning (or attention)
By the Fig and the Olive
And by Mount Sinai
And by this Safe City
Surely, We have created man in the best of moulds
Then We reduced him to the lowest of the low
Save those who believe and act right; for theirs is a reward unfailing
But what shall make you call the judgment after this a lie
Is not Allah the most wise (just or conclusive) of judges
READ (or proclaim), in the name of your Lord! Who created
Created man from a clot
Read (or proclaim), for your Lord is most Bountiful
Who teaches by the pen
Taught man what he did not know
Nay, verily, man is indeed rebellious
In that he thinks himself independent (or self-sufficient or rich)
Verily, unto your Lord is the return
Have you considered him who forbids
A servant when he prays
Have you considered if he were in guidance
Or bade piety
Have you considered if he denied the truth, and turned his back
Does he not know that Allah can see
Nay, surely, if he does not desist, We will drag him by the forelock
The lying sinful forelock
So let him call his council (or comrades)
We will call the guards of Hell
Nay, obey him not, but adore and draw nigh (unto Allah)
Verily, We sent it (the Quran) down on the Night of Power
And what shall make you know what the Night of Power is
The Night of Power is better than a thousand months
The angels and the Spirit descend therein, by the permission of their Lord with every decree
Peace it is until the rising of the dawn
Those of the People of the Book and the idolaters who disbelieve did not fall away until there came to them the Manifest Sign
A Messenger from Allah reading pure pages
Wherein are right scriptures
Nor did those who were given the Book divide into sects until after there came to them the Manifest Sign
But they were bidden nothing but to worship Allah, being sincere in religion unto Him as ´Hanifs´, and to be steadfast in prayer, and to give alms: for that is the true religion
Verily, those who disbelieve amongst the people of the Book and the idolaters shall be in the fire of hell, to dwell therein for aye; they are wretched creatures
Verily, those who believe and act aright, they are the best of creatures
Their reward with their Lord is Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein for aye; Allah shall be well pleased with them, and they with Him! That is for him who fears his Lord
When the earth shall be shaken with its quaking
And the earth shall bring forth her burdens
And man shall say, "What ails her
On that day she shall tell her tidings
Because your Lord inspires her
On the day when men shall come up in separate bands to show their works
And he who does the weight of an atom of good shall see it then
And he who does the weight of an atom of evil shall see it
By the snorting chargers
And those who strike fire with their hoofs
And those who make incursions in the morning
And raise up dust therein
And cleave through a host therein
Verily, man is to his Lord ungrateful
And, verily, he is a witness of that
Verily, he is keen in his love of wealth
Does he not know when the tombs are exposed
And what is in the breasts is brought to light
Verily, your Lord upon that day indeed is well aware
The calamity
What is the calamity
And what will convey to you what the calamity is
The day when men shall be like scattered moths
And the mountains shall be like flocks of carded wool
And as for him whose balance is heavy
He shall be in a well-pleasing life
But as for him whose balance is light
His mother will be the Bereft and Hungry One
And who shall convey to you what she is
A raging fire
The rivalry in worldly increase deludes you
Till you visit the graves
Nay! In the end you shall know
And again Nay! In the end you shall know
Nay! Did you but know with certain knowledge
You shall surely see hell
And again you shall surely see it with an eye of certainty
Then you shall surely be asked about pleasure
By the declining day
Verily, man is in a state of loss
Save those who believe and do good works, and bid each other to truth, and bid each other endurance
Woe to every slanderous scandal-monger and backbiter
Who collects wealth and counts it
He thinks that his wealth can immortalize him
Not so! He shall be hurled into El´Hutamah
Ah, what shall make you understand what El´Hutamah is
The Fire by Allah kindled
Which leaps into the heart
Lo! It closes in as a vault on them
In outstretched columns
See you not how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephant
Did He not make their stratagem lead them astray
And sent down on them birds in flocks
To pelt them with stones of baked clay
And make them like stalks left by herbage eaten down
For the taming (civilizing) of the Qureysh
Their covenant covers their caravans in winter and summer
So let them serve the Lord of this house
Who feeds them against hunger, and makes them safe against fear
Have you considered him who calls the judgment (or Religion) a lie
He it is who pushes the orphan away
And urges not (others) to feed the needy
But woe to those who pray
But are careless in their prayers
Who pretend for show
Yet withhold small kindnesses (or necessaries)
Verily, We have given you (Muhammad) El Kauthar (The Fountain of Abundance)
So pray to your Lord and sacrifice
Verily, he who insults you shall be issueless (cut off)
Say, "O you faithless
I do not serve what you serve
Nor will you serve what I serve
Nor will I serve what you serve
Nor will you serve what I serve
To you your Way and to me my Way
When there comes Allah´s help and victory
And you shall see men enter into Allah´s religion in crowds
Then celebrate the praises of your Lord, and ask forgiveness of Him, verily, He is Relenting
Perish shall the hands of The Father of Flame, and he shall perish
His wealth shall not avail him, nor what he has gained
He shall soon broil in a Fire that flames
And his wife shall carry the wood as fuel
On her own neck a cord of palm fibres
Say, "He is Allah, the One and Only
Allah the Absolute, on whom all things depend, besought by all
He begets not and is not begotten
Nor is there like unto Him any one
Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of the Dawn
From the evil of created things
And from the evil of the night when it cometh on
And from the evil of those who practice secret arts
And from the evil of the envious when he envies
Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord and Cherisher of mankind
The King (or Ruler) of mankind
The God (or Judge) of mankind
From the mischief of the Whisperer, who slinks off
Who whispers into the heart of men
From among Jinn and Men
